metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14586 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use after free vulnerability in EDK II may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege, information disclosure and/or denial of service via adjacent access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: edk2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0~20180205.c0d9813c-2ubuntu0.2').
